result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanya Victoria Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Pay $50 fine plus costs 
*Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tanya Victoria Wilson

records.addlTxt:
10:52 AM Defendant Tanya Victoria Wilson in court.  Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court for Tanya Victoria Wilson.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Cassidy calls the case and states the appearances.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
State is requesting that the Domestic Abuse Enhancer be dismissed.
Court questions the basis for the dismissal of the enhancer.
ADA Cassidy informs the Court as to why they have agreed upon this.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest 

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count1:  Disorderly Conduct 947.01(1).
Domestic Abuse Enhancer is stricken by the court.
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes (victim was a co-defendant at one point).
Victim is not present.

ADA Cassidy makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1:
Pay $50 fine plus costs, including the DNA surcharge
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office

ADDRESS INFO for Tanya Victoria Wilson
Current: 1020 Centerpoint Dr. #1423, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 02-04-2022)
Prior: 1170 Dodds Dr 1, Plover, WI 54467
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
